title: Top Ten Games To Buy Besides Halo 3: Commander Keen
content:
Here's a funny video that was made because of the Halo 3 hype. The funny thing is that at one point they mention even Commander Keen [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wormouth.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] .

I won't spoil more. Here, quote and link:

title: Re: Top Ten Games To Buy Besides Halo 3: Commander Keen
content:
Really, I don't get the hype about Halo games. Sure, it's probably a good game. But how could it possibly be THAT good??
I'd take a classic SNES or DOS game over the generic-super-violent state-of-the-art-graphics games any day.-Genius314

title: Re: Top Ten Games To Buy Besides Halo 3: Commander Keen
Re: Top Ten Games To Buy Besides Halo 3: Commander Keen
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Neat!

And yeah, not interested in Halo either... Can't understand what fascinates people in these modern games.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Top Ten Games To Buy Besides Halo 3: Commander Keen
content: I've found that the Halo games are fun at first but don't have too much lastability.  It's actually a little perplexing to me why it's so popular, since there's nothing particularly groundbreaking about it...there's lots of other very similar shooters out there.  Honestly, I've seen very few new games that don't just jump off on a previous concept.  Where's the originality in shooting things?  When somebody invents something really super original I'll be excited about it, but other than that I can't imagine being hooked on any new game for more than a month or two.  ("Interesting" is very important: I've played a game where, in some levels, you have to fish.  It's unbelievably boring.)[img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: Top Ten Games To Buy Besides Halo 3: Commander Keen
content:
I'm not crazy about Halo either, but I have to admit that even though it doesn't do anything original, it combines a lot of old concepts very well, and with a lot of polish. Throw in its status as one of the first good console FPS titles and the widely appealing generic sci-fi setting (and millions in marketing) and you have a megahit franchise.

[quote]Quote:[hr]("Interesting" is very important: I've played a game where, in some levels, you have to fish. It's unbelievably boring.)[hr][/quote]

Sonic Adventure, I presume.

title: Re: Top Ten Games To Buy Besides Halo 3: Commander Keen
content:
I'm not the biggest fan of Halo. I wouldn't play Halo 2 because it looks like it's just a graphics enhancement over the first, same with the 3rd, I'll probably play Halo 4 when the graphics get Crysis level.

But to me, Halo has a certain level of "fun" that most FPS's don't have, to name I play Medal of Honor AA a TON, it's one of my fave FPS games. But compared to Halo it has a cut and dry gameplay to it, whereas Halo has a little "bounce" to it, I don't know how to explain it, but it can just be fun to play, lol.

Don't get me wrong...those other FPS games are fun. But Halo's fun is different. The first Halo anyways, the other 2 to me look like they could just be summed up by "more weapons, better graphics".

content: I played Halo 3 last night.  It was actually pretty fun, even though it's basically Halo 2 with more weapons and vehicles. title: Re: Top Ten Games To Buy Besides Halo 3: Commander Keen
Re: Top Ten Games To Buy Besides Halo 3: Commander Keen
content:
Here's the thing, I love Halo.

I don't play it that often, but as far as FPS go, it's really pretty unique. Driving vehicles, two different types of weapons (energy and projectile), combining old ideas of campaign mode and huge multiplayer maps...

It's really a good game series. Over hyped? Well, yeah. But that's not reason to not see it as a good game series.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Top Ten Games To Buy Besides Halo 3: Commander Keen
content:
Yeah... while Halo was awesome, Halo 2 wasn't. If you read the blog-type-thing I have on my Deviant Art page... you already know that Halo 3 was a huge letdown. At least for me it was. Halo WAS ground breaking but Bungie didn't do ANYTHING with it in it's newer incarnations. Except for dual weapons. And a few new vehicles.

Besides... Halo for the PC beats Halo on the console anyway. (As PC is what it was programmed for.)-----------------------
